verses.kjv: Except the LORD build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the LORD keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.
verses.ct: Unless the LORD is the one constructing the house, the builders work for nothing. Unless the LORD is guarding the city, the watchman stays alert for nothing.

verses.kjv: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.
verses.ct: It's pointless for you to get up before dawn and stay up late into the night, working hard just to eat the bread of anxiety — because God provides rest to those he loves.

verses.kjv: Lo, children are an heritage of the LORD: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.
verses.ct: Pay attention: children are a gift from the LORD, and the offspring of your body are a reward from him.

verses.kjv: As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.
verses.ct: Like arrows in the grip of a warrior — that's what children born in your younger years are like.

verses.kjv: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.
verses.ct: How blessed is the person whose quiver is full of them! They won't be put to shame when they confront their opponents at the city gate.
